alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Peoria; Stark; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 18 at 10:46PM CDT until September 18 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marshall County in central Illinois... Northern Woodford County in central Illinois... Southeastern Stark County in north central Illinois... Northeastern Peoria County in central Illinois... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1046 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Varna to Lacon to near Wyoming, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Lacon, Henry and Varna around 1050 PM CDT. Toluca and Washburn around 1100 PM CDT. Chillicothe and Wenona around 1105 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Rome, Minonk, Metamora and Roanoke. This includes Interstate 39 between mile markers 22 and 40. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
